title: BRCA Mutation Carrier Seeking Prophylactic Surgery
setup_script: A 35-year-old woman with a BRCA1 mutation and strong family history of breast and ovarian cancer seeks counseling on risk-reducing strategies. She has no personal history of cancer and has completed childbearing.

dynamic_flow.trigger: Review her family history, genetic test results, and personal risk factors; assess her understanding of risks.
Discuss surveillance strategies: annual MRI and mammography, clinical breast exams every 6 months.
Explain prophylactic options: bilateral mastectomy with or without reconstruction, oophorectomy to reduce breast and ovarian cancer risk.
Address impact of surgery on body image, breastfeeding, and potential complications; involve plastic surgeon for reconstruction consultation.
Discuss timing of risk-reducing salpingo-oophorectomy and hormone replacement considerations.
Provide information on chemoprevention (tamoxifen) and lifestyle factors (exercise, diet).
If patient opts for prophylactic mastectomy, plan bilateral nipple-sparing mastectomy with immediate reconstruction.
Obtain informed consent; discuss risk of residual breast tissue and possible postoperative numbness or implant complications.
Coordinate with plastic surgery to choose reconstruction type (implant vs autologous flap).
Perform bilateral prophylactic mastectomy; send specimen for pathology to rule out occult carcinoma.
Postoperative care: manage drains, pain, and monitor for flap or implant complications; provide physical therapy.
Arrange long-term follow-up, including pelvic surveillance, discuss psychological support, and screen family members for BRCA mutation.

critical_decision_points: Comprehensive counseling on surveillance versus prophylactic surgery for BRCA carriers.
Coordination with plastic surgery and discussion of reconstruction options.
Executing risk-reducing mastectomy while preserving cosmetic outcome.
Addressing implications of oophorectomy and hormone management.
Providing psychosocial support and family counseling.
